holiday_email: Husband Appreciation Day is a celebration of husbands around the world, held annually on the third Saturday of April. It is a day to focus on recognizing the importance of husbands, celebrating their love, dedication, and contribution to the family. Everyone is encouraged to show these special men in their lives how much they are appreciated and loved.

holiday_blurb: Since the 1950s, this age-old tradition has brought families together around the world to share creative tales through story. Celebrate with old-fashioned campfire stories or more modern mediums like books and videos. Tell a Story Day is a great time for young and old to come together and create memories.
holiday_email: Tell a Story Day is an opportunity to share stories, connect with each other, and foster creativity. It encourages people to share something personal or simply create something unique, whether it's an original story, a beloved classic, or an old family tale. Everyone benefits from the engaging experience of telling stories!

holiday_blurb: International Dance Day is celebrated annually on April 29th, to commemorate the birth of Jean-Georges Noverre, the creator of modern ballet. It's a day to celebrate the art of dance around the world, with people of all ages and styles. Everyone is encouraged to take part, and experience the joy of freely expressing themselves through dance.
holiday_email: International Dance Day is an annual celebration of dance, its power to bring joy and understanding, and its unifying nature around the world. Celebrated on April 29th, the day is designed to inspire all of us to get up and move to express ourselves through the power of dance. It is an opportunity to appreciate the art of dance from all cultures and genres around the world.

holiday_blurb: National Baked Alaska Day commemorates the dessert, a combination of sponge cake topped with ice cream and browned meringue, invented by Parisian chef Charles Francatelli in the 1840s. The dessert was popularized in the United States by Thomas Jefferson who enjoyed it after a trip to Monticello. Celebrate this delicious treat by baking one of your own!
holiday_email: Celebrate National Baked Alaska Day by baking your favorite creamy, icy dessert! Baked Alaska is a classic dessert made of fluffy meringue, icy ice cream, and toasted to perfection for a crunchy, warm, and sweet delight. Enjoy a slice with family and friends and get your taste buds ready to indulge.

holiday_blurb: Ice Cream for Breakfast Day is a wacky holiday devoted to the art of eating ice cream—for breakfast! Originating in the late 1950s, this unofficial holiday is designed to have children and adults alike step out of their comfort zones, and enjoy a delicious scoop of ice cream while the sun is still rising!
holiday_email: Ice Cream for Breakfast Day is a fun annual event celebrated by foodies everywhere, where indulging in breakfast food made from the creamiest of ice cream is encouraged! Celebrate each year by cooking up your favorite ice cream-based breakfast recipes or ordering a hearty ice cream breakfast from your favorite local spot!

holiday_blurb: Celebrate National Fettucine Alfredo Day! Originally created in Rome in 1914, this classic dish is a blend of butter, parmesan cheese and cream tossed with fresh fettucine noodles. Enjoy it any way you like: plain, with chicken, with shrimp, or with your favorite vegetables. Delizioso!
holiday_email: Celebrate National Fettuccine Alfredo Day and indulge in one of Italy's most beloved recipes. Get creative with your Alfredo sauce, add some extra spices and maybe some veggies for a delicious pasta dish that will have your taste buds dancing! Enjoy this creamy and comforting Italian classic today.

holiday_blurb: National Flannel Day is a celebration of the traditional plaid shirt! It started in the 1990s as a grassroots movement to recognize the classic "uniform of the 90s" and has grown into a beloved holiday on the second Saturday of October each year. It's a chance to don your favorite flannel and celebrate with style!
holiday_email: National Flannel Day celebrates the beloved winter fabric and all its cozy goodness. Take this day to embrace the snuggly comfort of plaid flannels and enjoy staying warm and cozy! Make sure to stock up on your favorite flannel patterns for the winter and beyond!

holiday_blurb: National Gumdrop Day is celebrated each year and is an opportunity for people to indulge in their favorite candy treats and share the sweet experience with friends and family. This holiday has its roots in the Victorian Era, when doctors would offer gumdrops to children in order to tempt them to take their medicines!
holiday_email: National Gumdrop Day is an annual holiday celebrated today! It's a day to celebrate those sweet, chewy, colorful, sugar-coated poppable treats - gumdrops! Celebrate the day by making a batch of homemade gumdrops, creating delightful and delicious decorations with them, or simply enjoying some of your favorite store-bought gumdrops.

holiday_blurb: Innovation Day encourages innovative thinking. It started in 2019 and has since become a popular global event. Get creative and challenge yourself to find new solutions to existing problems. Celebrate the potential of a better future through creative thinking. #InnovationDay
holiday_email: Innovation Day is an event that celebrates and promotes out-of-the-box thinking. It encourages people to push the boundaries of their thinking and find creative solutions to problems, making it a great event for entrepreneurs, creatives and tech enthusiasts!

holiday_blurb: Celebrate National Cabbage Day! This day is dedicated to recognizing the versatility and nutritional value of this humble vegetable. Cabbage has been cultivated since Ancient Roman times and the health benefits are still recognized today. So get your cabbage fix and enjoy this veggie in all its delicious forms!
holiday_email: Celebrate National Cabbage Day today! This festive occasion promotes the nutrition, versatility, and taste of cabbage in all its forms. Whether you opt for cooked cabbage, a savory coleslaw, or a delicious fermented sauerkraut, there's something for everyone. Enjoy the health benefits and delicious taste of cabbage on National Cabbage Day!

holiday_blurb: Hoodie Hoo Day is an unofficial holiday and is an opportunity to celebrate and express joy by sharing a spirited yell of "Hoodie-Hoo!" at noon. Some believe it dates back to pagan rituals from ancient times. Others say it's a modern-day tradition. Whether ancient or modern, it's a fun day to enjoy with friends or family.
holiday_email: Hoodie Hoo Day is an annual event that takes place today! Participants holler "Hoodie Hoo!" at noon, in celebration of the start of spring. It's a great excuse to get out of the winter blues and spread some joy and positivity! So, grab a hoodie and join the fun!

holiday_blurb: World Bartender Day celebrates the craft of bartending around the world, highlighting the importance bartenders have in connecting us to cultures and stories. First celebrated in 1989 by the International Bartenders Association, it is an international day of recognition for the work of bartenders around the world.
holiday_email: World Bartender Day is an international celebration of the hard-working people behind the bar, recognizing their skills and creative spirit. It's an opportunity to raise a glass in gratitude towards these vital members of the hospitality industry - for they are the ones that truly make a night out memorable!

holiday_blurb: Carpe Diem Day marks a time for seizing the moment by appreciating and embracing the current day. It dates back to the Roman poet, Horace, who famously wrote the phrase in 23 BC, meaning "seize the day". This day serves as a reminder to pursue what our hearts desire and savor every moment.
holiday_email: Carpe Diem Day is a day to "seize the day", maximize life's potential and make the most of every moment. It encourages us to break out of our routines and routines to make time for adventure, creativity, and self-care. Make this day count!

holiday_blurb: Apple Gifting Day has been celebrated around the world since the late 90s, when the company first introduced Apple Macs. On this day, Apple fans come together to exchange gifts and celebrate the innovative products and ideas that have made the brand so iconic. Whether you're an Apple fan from the beginning or just getting started, join us this Apple Gifting Day and show your love for the brand!
holiday_email: Celebrate the season with family & friends on Apple Gifting Day! Give the perfect gift with Apple's online store, offering the latest products and accessories. Whether it's the perfect tech gift for your loved ones or the perfect accessory for yourself, Apple Gifting Day has something for everyone.

holiday_blurb: Buffet Day honors the ubiquitous all-you-can-eat buffet. It is believed to have originated from an Italian tradition called "Gran Gasse", where large grape festivals were held with a host of incredible culinary masterpieces. Nowadays, Buffet Day is celebrated with family-style dinners, where guests stock up on favorites like salads, meats, seafood, and desserts!
holiday_email: Buffet Day is a celebration of all-you-can-eat buffets around the world! The day is perfect for filling up on your favorite dishes or trying something new. Dig in and enjoy!

holiday_blurb: National Bird Day is an international celebration held annually to raise awareness about the protection and preservation of birds. Flying since 2005, the event encourages the public to appreciate their avian friends and when possible, to provide them with a safe habitat. It’s a celebration of avian diversity, as members of the public are encouraged to seek out, observe, and protect wild birds across the world.
holiday_email: National Bird Day is an annual celebration that honors all feathered creatures and raises awareness of bird conservation and protection. This special day gives bird enthusiasts a chance to celebrate and learn about the bird species in their local area, as well as appreciate and protect them for future generations.

holiday_blurb: National Apricot Day is an annual celebration of one of the world’s oldest fruits. Originating in China over 4,000 years ago, apricot culture has spread across many countries and is celebrated by many. On this day, enjoy this sweet, juicy fruit by incorporating it into food, drinks, desserts, and more!
holiday_email: National Apricot Day is celebrated annually around the world today. This day celebrates the delicious and nutritious fruit by indulging in apricot-flavored dishes, desserts, and drinks. People also enjoy learning its amazing health benefits and commemorating the day in creative ways.

holiday_blurb: National Take the Stairs Day is an annual event and its goal is to encourage people to take the stairs instead of elevators or escalators as an easy way to increase physical activity. The holiday has been celebrated since 2005, when the National Take the Stairs initiative began encouraging people to take the stairs for their health and wellbeing.
holiday_email: National Take the Stairs Day is an annual event that celebrates the health benefits of taking the stairs over elevators or escalators. It's a day to promote physical activity, as walking up stairs is great exercise! Take the Stairs Day encourages us all to make a conscious effort to avoid the elevators and escalators and get moving.

holiday_name: National Dress Up Your Pet Day
holiday_blurb: National Dress Up Your Pet Day is a day to love and appreciate your pet even more! On this day, owners celebrate their furry friends by dressing them up in fun outfits and capturing the moments in photos. This silly holiday has been celebrated since 2009 and is held every year. So get out your costumes and treats and join in the fun!
holiday_email: Celebrate your furry best friend on National Dress Up Your Pet Day! Have fun dressing them up in their favorite costumes, creating hilarious and unique looks! Show off your pet's personality through this fun activity and create memories that will last a lifetime!

holiday_blurb: National Penguin Day is celebrated every year, and is a day dedicated to recognizing the adorable flightless birds. It is believed to have first been celebrated in the 1990's and remains a yearly occurrence enjoyed by wildlife enthusiasts. Fans of penguins are encouraged to observe the day by learning more about penguins and sharing their incredible characteristics with friends and family.
holiday_email: National Penguin Day celebrates the adorable and captivating penguins all over the world. It’s a day for appreciating their intelligence, beauty, playfulness, and resilience. Penguins make the Earth a more joyful place, so take a moment and appreciate them!

holiday_blurb: Celebrated each year, National Pie Day is an ode to the delicious desserts we have come to enjoy. This day was started in the mid-1970s by a nuclear physicist in Oregon. This yearly holiday has become an international event and a chance to seek out some of your favorite cakes and pies. Enjoy!
holiday_email: National Pie Day is celebrated on January 23rd every year. It is a day to celebrate all pies, from sweet to savory, and everything in between. Whether it's an apple, cherry, key lime, or other delicious concoction, it's a day to enjoy pie and all its sweet goodness. So, grab a slice, and have a happy National Pie Day!

holiday_blurb: Celebrate National Chocolate Cake Day every year! This day honors the delicious treat and has been celebrated since the early 1900s. Enjoy a slice (or two) and share the love with family and friends!
holiday_email: National Chocolate Cake Day is a day for indulgence and celebration! Enjoy each delicious bite and savor the unique flavor of this delightful dessert. Celebrate with friends and family to enjoy the sweet treat and honor the traditions of this annual food holiday.

holiday_blurb: Celebrate National Croissant Day! Enjoy a delicious layer of buttery pastry and a cup of joe. This special day originated as a tribute to the classic French pastry, first created in Austria in the 18th century. Now savor a modern twist on the beloved treat!
holiday_email: National Croissant Day is celebrated today! This light, flaky and buttery pastry has been delighting sweet-toothed foodies for centuries. Enjoy a classic, Nutella-stuffed or savory croissant in honor of the holiday!

holiday_blurb: Extra Mile Day is an annual global celebration of goodness, kindness, and generosity, where people around the world go the extra mile and take time to do something special for one another. It was first celebrated in 2007 and has grown every year with people in more than 100 countries taking part.
holiday_email: Extra Mile Day is a time to recognize and celebrate hard work, dedication, and perseverance. It's a day to recognize those who go the extra mile in their work, relationships and lives. Everyone can benefit from taking time to give and receive appreciation for the extra efforts we all make to improve our lives.

holiday_blurb: Use Your Common Sense Day encourages us to make sensible decisions rather than rash ones. It's a day to think before you act, helping you create a life that reflects your true values. It was founded by Matthew Kelly, a best-selling author who believes making the right choices helps us live the best lives.
holiday_email: Use Your Common Sense Day is an awareness day to celebrate the power of the mind. It encourages people to think rationally, look at all sides of an issue, and consider the practical implications of decisions. May 21st aims to promote clear thinking and the thoughtful application of rational thinking. Celebrate Use Your Common Sense Day by evaluating ideas and solutions with logic!

holiday_name: Go to an Art Museum Day
holiday_blurb: Go to an Art Museum Day is an international celebration of art, culture, and education. Every year, people around the world come together to visit local museums to learn about art history, appreciate unique artwork, and experience the creative power of collaboration. The day was founded in 2014 to promote the celebration and appreciation of art and artistic expression.
holiday_email: Go to an Art Museum Day is the perfect day to explore the creative wonders of art. It's a day to broaden your horizons, to express your individual style, and to appreciate the great masterpieces of history. Let yourself be inspired by the greatest works of art, and discover something new that resonates with your spirit.

holiday_blurb: World Kindness Day is celebrated every year to highlight good deeds and remind us of the importance of being kind. It was created in 1998 by the World Kindness Movement and many countries celebrate it as a way to encourage benevolence and altruism. Join in and give your part of kindness to others!
holiday_email: World Kindness Day is a day dedicated to celebrating kindness and recognizing its power. It's about coming together to create a kinder, more positive world, and offers an opportunity to focus on the good in each other. Join in - be kind, do something nice, and help spread kindness worldwide!

holiday_blurb: Raisin Bran Cereal Day is celebrated annually to honor this beloved breakfast classic. It was introduced in the early 1930s by the Kellogg's company - a pioneering producer of ready-to-eat cereals. Raisin Bran's mix of crunchy bran flakes and sweet raisins makes it a nutritious and flavorful start to the day. Celebrate it by eating a bowl and savoring the taste!
holiday_email: Raisin Bran cereal is a breakfast favorite for a reason - it's both delicious and nutritious. Celebrate Raisin Bran Cereal Day and enjoy a wholesome bowl of your favorite cereal topped with some fresh fruits or a dollop of delicious yogurt. Start your day off right with a nutritious breakfast that both tastes and looks great!

holiday_blurb: National Princess Day is a day to celebrate beauty, strength, and the universal power of female leadership. It was created to honor Princess Diana and her legacy of style, kindness, and grace, and is now observed around the world to recognize the contributions of modern-day princesses like Moana and Elsa. Celebrate National Princess Day by dressing up as your favorite princess or exploring the world of royal-inspired activities!
holiday_email: National Princess Day is a day to celebrate all things princess-related. Girls and women of all ages are encouraged to dress up as their favourite princess, make princess-themed crafts and share stories of their favourite princes and princesses. Get creative and let your inner princess shine! #NationalPrincessDay

holiday_blurb: Go For a Ride Day encourages people to break out of their routine and explore the world by taking a scenic drive. Established in 1998 to honor the 70th anniversary of the AAA, it's an annual reminder to explore, connect with nature, and create memories.
holiday_email: Go For a Ride Day celebrates the joy and freedom of taking a ride, whether it's out on a bike, in a car, or on horseback. So get out there, grab some fresh air, and explore the beauty of the world around you!

holiday_blurb: Celebrate Your Unique Talent Day is a great opportunity to embrace the unique skills that make you who you are. Founded to give people the confidence to embrace their talents in a lighthearted manner regardless of age or ability, this day has been celebrated worldwide for over 25 years. Why not take time to recognize your own special talents and celebrate the things that make you a unique individual?
holiday_email: Celebrate Your Unique Talent Day is a day to recognize and appreciate your individual talents. On this day, take some time to celebrate the gifts that make you unique - whether it’s writing, singing, dancing, playing an instrument, cooking, or another skill you’ve honed. Be proud of your talents, big and small, and recognize the value they bring to your life and the lives of others.

holiday_name: National Eat a Red Apple Day
holiday_blurb: Celebrate the deliciousness of apples and the bounty of the autumn harvest on National Eat a Red Apple Day! Apples have been a popular food in many cultures and religions since antiquity. Enjoy some tart and juicy red apples on National Eat a Red Apple Day and appreciate the contribution of this healthy fruit to your diet and wellbeing!
holiday_email: National Eat a Red Apple Day is an annual day celebrating the health benefits of the delicious red apple. Enjoy the natural sweetness and delight of the crisp, juicy apple as it helps reduce cholesterol, increase heart health, and boost your immunity!

holiday_blurb: Make a Gift Day is a special day to share with those in need. It encourages individuals, organizations and groups to make homemade gifts or donate money or items to those who don't have the means to provide for themselves. The tradition started over 20 years ago and has since been embraced by people throughout the world. Show someone you care by participating in Make a Gift Day!
holiday_email: Make a Gift Day celebrates the joy of giving! It's a chance to share something special with those we love, to remind them how much they are appreciated, and to put a smile on their face. Join us in making the world a more generous place, and celebrate Make a Gift Day! #MAKEGIFTDAY

holiday_blurb: National Microwave Oven Day celebrates the invention of the microwave oven. Released in 1967, this revolutionary kitchen appliance changed the way we cook. Celebrate this day with a meal cooked in the the microwave— just be sure to heat it up for no longer than a minute or two!
holiday_email: National Microwave Oven Day celebrates the invention of the microwave oven. It is celebrated annually, and is a reminder of the time-saving convenience that the microwave provides! Microwave ovens are capable of reheating, defrosting, and cooking meals in record time!

holiday_blurb: International Animal Rights Day is a global event held annually to celebrate, recognize, and protect the rights of animals around the world. It has been celebrated since 2002, with the aim of raising awareness of the often-unmentioned mistreatment of animals, and the need for their rights to be respected.
holiday_email: International Animal Rights Day is an annual event held to raise awareness of animal rights and suffering. It is celebrated around the world to remember past and present animals that have experienced injustice and to remind us all that humans have a responsibility to treat other species with respect.

holiday_blurb: National Cat Herders Day recognizes the hard work of all those (human or feline) in the creative and challenging profession of feline herding. With roots tracing back to a series of humorous advertisements in the 1970s, the day is an opportunity to recognize the unique skills and dedication required of "cat herders" all over the world.
holiday_email: National Cat Herders Day is today! It is a day to recognize individuals and organizations who work hard to find homes for cats in need. Whether fostering, sheltering, rescuing or TNRing, this day celebrates the hardworking people who take on the responsibility of caring for, and getting cats adopted into their forever homes. #CatHerdersDay

holiday_blurb: Gingerbread House Day celebrates the whimsical and beloved tradition of creating and decorating edible houses. Dating back to 16th century Germany, when gingerbread houses became popular with folk tales of Hansel and Gretel, this sweet holiday encourages creativity and delight. Bake, decorate, and share the love!
holiday_email: Gingerbread House Day is the perfect day to get creative with the whole family and make a memorable edible masterpiece. This holiday encourages everyone to gather, roll up their sleeves and make a yummy and sweet dream house, complete with icing and candy decorations. Celebrate the day of joy and festivities while creating a unique work of art!

holiday_blurb: Celebrate Crossword Puzzle Day on December 21! This holiday commemorates Arthur Wynne's first published crossword in the New York World in 1913. Challenge yourself and others to test their wits and have fun in the process!
holiday_email: Crossword Puzzle Day is a day to celebrate the beloved pastime of solving word puzzles! Whether you're a novice puzzler or a crossword pro, spend the day challenging your wits and vocabulary to fill in some of the world's best word puzzles. Celebrate by pitting yourself against your friends and family, and revel in the satisfaction of triumphantly finishing that last clue!

holiday_blurb: National Eggnog Day celebrates one of the most beloved holiday beverages: eggnog. Originating in medieval Britain, it eventually made its way to the United States and is now enjoyed around the world. From spiced to baileys-infused, celebrate this holiday classic with friends and family.
holiday_email: Celebrate National Eggnog Day today! From classic creamy eggnog to a spectrum of delicious flavors, this holiday beverage is sure to make any celebration special. Enjoy eggnog as a dessert or festive latte, or simply curl up with a mug of eggnog and savor its traditional holiday cheer.

holiday_blurb: Call a Friend Day is a day dedicated to reconnecting with old friends and socializing. It encourages people to reach out and have meaningful conversations. It was started in 2008 and is celebrated annually. On this day, people reach out to old friends and loved ones to remind them how much they care.
holiday_email: Call a Friend Day is the perfect occasion to express your love and appreciation for those special people in your life. Pick up the phone and tell them how much they mean to you. Hearing your voice and kind words will make their day—and your own! Celebrate the power of friendship and make someone smile today.

holiday_blurb: Balloons Around the World Day is an annual event, created in 2011. It reminds us to take the time to appreciate the joy, whimsical beauty, and possibilities that balloons bring to our lives. This holiday is a chance to send a balloon into the sky with a wish, draw a special wish in the sky, or honor someone important in our life.
holiday_email: Balloons Around the World Day is a day of celebration! It is a perfect time to reunite with friends and family to share stories, laugh and decorate the sky with a multitude of colors. Who knew a bunch of helium-filled balloons could bring such joy? Join us in commemorating the sky with rainbows!

holiday_blurb: Celebrate National Taco Day on October 4th and enjoy the tasty combination of meat, veggies, cheese, and spices wrapped in a warm tortilla. Started by National Taco Day founder, Juan Coulson, this holiday has been celebrated since 2009 to appreciate the tasty Mexican delicacy. Enjoy tacos that day without any guilt!
holiday_email: National Taco Day celebrates the deliciousness of tacos every year. Celebrate with your favorite tacos - from tacos al pastor and carne asada loaded with toppings, to the classic hard taco shell houses of ground beef and smothered in cheese. Whatever your taco preference, it's time to join the fiesta and grab a taco!

holiday_blurb: National Bicarbonate of Soda Day celebrates one of America's oldest and most versatile products. Used in baking, cleaning, scratch removers, and many other applications, bicarbonate of soda is a natural, non-toxic staple found in many households. Each year the world celebrates this useful, time-honored product.
holiday_email: National Bicarbonate of Soda Day celebrates the many uses of this all-purpose ingredient! From cooking and baking to cleaning, deodorizing, and even medicinal applications, bicarbonate of soda can be a true powerhouse in the kitchen and home. Let's all take the time to recognize its amazing versatility!

holiday_blurb: National Hug a Drummer Day is an informal holiday celebrated every year. The day acknowledges the hard work of drummers and their unique contributions to all types of music. It was first celebrated in 2001 to honor the influence of drummers and their art form. Celebrate the day by giving a drummer in your life a big hug!
holiday_email: National Hug a Drummer Day is celebrated every year to show love and appreciation for drummers of all kinds! Each year, drummers around the world get a special hug from their musical peers and fans. Join in the fun and let everyone know just how much you appreciate the hard work our drummers put in!

holiday_blurb: National No Bra Day is an annual event celebrated every year to encourage women to go braless in an effort to raise awareness about breast cancer and its causes. Women are encouraged to join in this event to show solidarity and spread the message that the body should be celebrated, despite the risks of breast cancer. The exact origin of the holiday is unknown, but modern celebrations have been held since the early 2000s.
holiday_email: National No Bra Day is an annual day designed to promote breast health and to remind women (and men!) to perform breast health exams. This day is a reminder to women all over the world that wearing a bra is not mandatory and having an understanding of breast health is essential. Celebrate National No Bra Day by checking for lumps and taking steps to remain breast healthy.

holiday_name: National Clean Your Virtual Desktop Day
holiday_blurb: National Clean Your Virtual Desktop Day is an annual event encouraging individuals, businesses, and educational institutions to take time to tidy up their digital workspaces. It's held on the third Monday in October to promote healthier working habits & increase productivity. This awareness day was founded in 2017 by IT professionals who understand the importance of decluttering.
holiday_email: National Clean Your Virtual Desktop Day encourages tech-savvy individuals to take time and organize their digital workspace. It’s a day to refresh your desktop, delete unused files, rearrange your folders and create backups of important files. A clean and organized digital environment is essential for productivity, so take the time to make it just right.

holiday_blurb: National Make New Friends Day is celebrated annually. It is a day to welcome new people into your life, connect with those you haven't seen in a while, or just learn about individuals from different backgrounds. The day has been celebrated as a part of the National Friendship Day events since 2011.
holiday_email: National Make New Friends Day is a day to celebrate relationships and break out of the daily routine to meet someone new! Taking the time to reach out to someone unfamiliar and develop a bond can be a rewarding experience, and this special day encourages us to take the initiative and crave connection with others. Celebrate by striking up a conversation with someone new today!

holiday_blurb: Smart is Cool Day celebrates the joy of learning! It was founded in 2013 by a group of educators and parents who wanted to encourage students to have fun while learning. Every year, students and families around the world join together in celebrating the power of knowledge. They share stories of success, mark their accomplishments, and recognize the importance of education.
holiday_email: Smart is Cool Day is an annual event that celebrates the power of intellect. It reminds us that intelligence is something to be proud of, and encourages us to share our gifts with those around us. From educational activities to inspiring stories, Smart is Cool Day is a great reminder that brains can be cool!

holiday_blurb: Ugliest Dog Day celebrates the unique beauty of all dogs, from purebreds to mix breeds alike. On this day, dog owners around the world can show off their pooches in all their "ugly" glory. The holiday started in 2004 when the Sonoma-Marin Fair in Petaluma, California hosted an ugly dog contest, and the participation and enthusiasm it generated has made it a beloved annual tradition ever since.
holiday_email: Ugliest Dog Day celebrates the world's fugliest furry friends. Every year, the ugliest pup is crowned the winner! It's a humorous event that reminds us all that beauty is in the eye of the beholder. Who's the ugliest of them all?

holiday_blurb: Celebrate your individualism with Bandana Day! This worldwide holiday is a great opportunity to show off your style! The story of Bandana Day goes back to the 19th century, when bandanas were used as a symbol of unity by oppressed workers in their fight for justice and recognition. Today, we commemorate this important part of history by wearing the iconic symbol of freedom as a sign of solidarity.
holiday_email: Bandana Day is an annual event celebrated around the world! On this day, people wear bandanas to show their support for a cause close to their heart, or to honor those important to them. It is also a chance for everyone to come together and feel united in a shared passion.

holiday_blurb: National Checklist Day celebrates the power of organization. On this day, we take time to remind ourselves to prioritize the task at hand. Established in 2019, National Checklist Day encourages individuals to use lists to stay efficient and productive throughout their daily tasks. Everyone can benefit from organization!
holiday_email: National Checklist Day celebrates the importance of lists and checklists in day-to-day life. It's a day to make sure our lives are running smoothly and free from stress. Checklists help us stay organized and stay on track, so celebrate National Checklist Day every year and make sure you have all your ducks in a row!

holiday_blurb: National Snack Day is an annual celebration of everyday indulgence. Celebrated each year, Food Lion became the official sponsor of the event in 2015. National Snack Day celebrates the small and satisfying snacks we reach for in between meals.
holiday_email: Happy National Snack Day! Celebrate with your favorite treats! Whether it’s picked from the pantry or delivered with door dash, enjoy taking a break from routine to indulge in a delicious snack. Everyone has their go-to favorite, so join in on the fun today and treat yourself to a guilt-free snack time.

holiday_blurb: National Frozen Food Day honors the invention of the frozen food industry. The first commercially produced frozen meals arrived in 1930, making meals much easier to store and prepare. Today, frozen foods can be found in many grocery stores, allowing for quick and tasty meals. Celebrate with a frozen meal of your choice!
holiday_email: National Frozen Food Day is a special day to celebrate all our favorite frozen treats! From pizzas to ice cream, let's thank the delicious frozen foods that make life and meals easier. Grab your favorite, throw it in the oven, and celebrate National Frozen Food Day!

holiday_blurb: Celebrate National Crabmeat Day! Enjoy a variety of dishes featuring crabmeat from delicious bisques to crabcakes. This special day has been celebrated since the 1940s in the Chesapeake Bay area and is recognized as a day to enjoy the incredibly flavorful and nutritious seafood.
holiday_email: National Crabmeat Day celebrates the beloved shellfish with its sweet, delicate flavour! Today is an opportunity to indulge in all delicious crab dishes that can be found globally. From summer backyard barbecues to waterfront seafood buffets, it's the perfect excuse to savor the succulent taste of crab.

holiday_blurb: Earmuff Day is a fun and unique holiday to celebrate the invention of the modern-day earmuff! This holiday was first observed in 1873, when American physician Chester Greenwood patented the earmuff and millions of people around the world adopted them for wintertime warmth. Celebrate by donning your favorite set of earmuffs and enjoying the warmth they provide!
